data.description: Job Description:**THIS JOB POSTING IS FOR CURRENT INTERNS ONLY**Are you ready to start your technology career with Fidelity Investments? Join us and apply for a position in our full-time LEAP Technology Immersion Program today! LEAP is Fidelity's learner-centered technology program crafted to prepare recent graduates to become leading technologists. Upon completion, participants are placed within our diverse technology organization for continued full-time employment in multiple roles and locations throughout the US.THE SKILLS YOU BRINGRecent completion or in current pursuit of a Computer Science, Software Engineering, or IT bachelor’s degreeA solid understanding of software development principles and data structuresHands-on technical project experience: Previous technical internship experience is a plusOutstanding problem-solving ability and analytical skillsAbility to work to achieve group goals in a fast-paced environment to achievePassionate about learning new technologiesNote: The LEAP program does not offer visa sponsorshipPROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS The LEAP program is designed to build a solid foundation of a culture of continuous development through high-impact learning experiences. LEAP offers candidates an opportunity to join Fidelity full-time in one of four different areas of technology:-Software Engineer: Design and develop premium digital applications in an Agile environment across multiple frameworks and platforms. We look for knowledge with front-end (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), middle-tier (Java, NodeJS) and back-end (SQL) languages and frameworks. Experience with Spring, Angular, or similar technologies is a plus.-Data Engineer: Design data-centered software solutions to organize Fidelity’s information assets and conduct analysis to obtain and share insights. We require knowledge SQL and Python. Experience in data visualization, data integration, and an understanding of database modelling is preferred.COMPREHENSIVE BENEFITS DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE A BALANCED LIFE  Student loan assistance and tuition reimbursement for eligible employees23 days of paid time off per year plus 9 paid Federal holidaysOpportunities to volunteer and give to your local community during work hoursOnsite fitness & wellness centers as well as company subsidized healthy meal options at onsite cafeteriasTo learn about additional benefits, click here.At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and cultivating a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.comFidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.Certifications:Category:Information TechnologyMost roles at Fidelity are Hybrid, requiring associates to work onsite every other week (all business days, M-F) in a Fidelity office. This does not apply to Remote or fully Onsite roles.Please be advised that Fidelity’s business is governed by the provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, the Investment Company Act of 1940, ERISA, numerous state laws governing securities, investment and retirement-related financial activities and the rules and regulations of numerous self-regulatory organizations, including FINRA, among others. Those laws and regulations may restrict Fidelity from hiring and/or associating with individuals with certain Criminal Histories.
requirements: Recent completion or in current pursuit of a Computer Science, Software Engineering, or IT bachelor’s degree
responsibilities: A solid understanding of software development principles and data structures
